entity.name: PID
entity.doc: Discrete proportional, integral, and derivative controller.

property.name: text
property.value:
The output X is the distance from the fault to substation A.
The equations for determining X are as follows:
speed*(TA-T0)= X speed*(TB-T0)= D - X
where T0 is time of fault (which is unknown), TA is the time of fault detection at substation A, TB is the time of fault detection at substation B, speed is the speed of propagation along the transmission line (the speed of light), D is the distance from A to B, and D-X is the distance from B to the fault. Hence,
X = [(TA-TB)*speed + D]/2
Since the input events occur at different times, the Synchronizer requires one data value from each input port before it will do a calculation. Note that inputs will be misaligned if one of the substations fails to detect the event and provide an input, so a more realistic model needs to be more sophisticated.
